availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fleet H. Goodridge, Jr. (Henry County, Kentucky, student.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, student. Kentucky native. Son of Fleet H. Goodridge, Sr., and Elizabeth Goodridge. Attended school in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Attended school in Henry County in 1860. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Killed by William D. Mitchell in Henry County in December 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry District 2, p. 441B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 398.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 188A.
"Homicide," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), December 2, 1862, p. 3.
"Died of His Wounds," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), December 3, 1862, p. 3.
"Fleet H Goodridge Jr. (1843-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial 28350358, accessed December 13, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28350358.
